intro: Galium relbun, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant features slender, often prostrate stems that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and usually have a hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium relbun is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
